item.title: OKCPS central office flubs calculation, has to reset last day of school
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Through a miscalculation, Oklahoma City Public Schools central administration officials set the wrong date for the last day of school earlier in April and, then, corrected it Thursday. Calling the error “an honest mistake,” in a written statement to the media Thursday, Chief Communications Officer Beth Harrison said that the district’s last day of school […]

The post OKCPS central office flubs calculation, has to reset last day of school appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Enduring enterprise – John Marshall Mid-High
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The talk sometimes heard around some young parents in the city’s core is that Oklahoma City Public Schools are great in the elementary years. But after that, you better get your kid into one of the Edmond Schools. John Marshall Enterprise Mid-High senior Kennedy Angstadt did just the opposite when she transferred from an Edmond […]

The post Enduring enterprise – John Marshall Mid-High appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: “Senior Walk” tradition inspires younger students at Millwood
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Each year seniors go through one more ritual earlier in the day before the graduation ceremony at Millwood Public Schools. It’s called the “senior walk.” Thursday, this year’s graduating class completed the tradition. Dressed in their graduation robes, seniors walked single-file starting in the elementary school, then the middle school and ending among their peers […]

The post “Senior Walk” tradition inspires younger students at Millwood appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Access granted! New mobile hot spots provide home internet to students
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Jamarco Prim was one of the first students at John Marshall High School in Oklahoma City Public Schools to check out a new, small internet hot spot device Thursday. It will give him filtered access so that he can complete his school work. “Mostly it’s going to help me at home because I don’t really […]

The post Access granted! New mobile hot spots provide home internet to students appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.
